author: Staff Reporter
text:
Amit Shah will shortly announce the candidates, says Saminathan

BJP Puducherry unit president V. Saminathan and General Secretary (organisation) Shreepad Desh Pandey meet Prime Minister Narandera Modi, National party president Amit shah and other National Election Committee members in New Delhi on Friday.— Photo: Special Arrangement

Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) Puducherry unit president V. Saminathan on Friday met Prime Minister Narendra Modi, party chief Amit Shah and members of the national election committee to finalise the poll strategy and the preliminary list of candidates for the May 16 Assembly polls.

Mr. Saminathan said that he had apprised the leadership about the ground realties and party’s prospects in the Union Territory in the Assembly elections.

The preliminary candidate list for all the 30 constituencies in the UT has been submitted.

The Central Election Committee of the BJP headed by Mr. Shah will announce the list of candidates shortly, he said.

Senior leader and Union Minister M. Venkaiah Naidu and local leaders had stated during earlier occasions that the party has been ready to work with the ruling AINRC in the Union Territory of Puducherry.

However, AINRC president and Chief Minister N. Rangasamy had not come out openly about forging an alliance so far.
title: BJP leader submits list of probable contestants
